text: The Massachusetts general election, 2016 was held on November 8, 2016, throughout Massachusetts. All 160 seats of the Massachusetts House of Representatives and all 40 seats of the Massachusetts Senate were up for election. The primary election for state offices was held on September 8. Early voting was used for the first time, and took place from October 24 through November 4. ==Federal Elections== ===Presidential election=== Official state results from the Massachusetts Secretary of State are as follows {| border="1" cellpadding="4" cellspacing="0" style="margin: 1em 1em 1em 0; background: #f9f9f9; border: 1px #aaa solid; border-collapse: collapse; font- size: 95%;" |- style="background:#e9e9e9;" ! colspan="7" | United States presidential election in Massachusetts, 2016 |- style="background:#eee; text- align:center;" ! colspan="2" style="width: 15em" |Party ! style="width: 17em" |Candidate ! style="width: 17em" |Running Mate ! style="width: 5em" |Votes ! style="width: 7em" |Percentage ! style="width: 5em" |Electoral votes |- ! style="background:#33f; width:3px;"| | style="width: 130px" | Democratic | Hillary Clinton | Tim Kaine | style="text-align:right;"| 1,995,196 | style="text-align:right;"| 60.8% | style="text-align:right;"| 11 |- ! style="background:#f33; width:3px;"| | style="width: 130px" | Republican | Donald Trump | Mike Pence | style="text-align:right;"| 1,090,893 | style="text-align:right;"| 33.5% | style="text-align:right;"| 0 |- ! style="background:#fc0; width:3px;"| | style="width: 130px" | Libertarian | Gary Johnson | William Weld | style="text-align:right;"| 136,784 | style="text-align:right;"| 4.2% | style="text-align:right;"| 0 |- ! style="background:#0bda51; width:3px;"| | style="width: 130px" | Green | Jill Stein | Ajamu Baraka | style="text-align:right;"| 46,910 | style="text- align:right;"| 1.5% | style="text-align:right;"| 0 |- style="background:#eee; text-align:right;" | colspan="4"| Totals || 3,269,783 || 100.00% || 11 |} ===U.S. House=== ==General Court== ===Summary=== Senate {| class="wikitable" |- ! colspan="2" | Affiliation !
